newsitem.title: USA: Protein Design says Protovir tests positive.
newsitem.headline: Protein Design says Protovir tests positive.

text.p: Protein Design Labs Inc Tuesday said results of a Phase II clinical trial of Protovir, a human anti-cytomegalovirus (CMV) antibody, show the drug might be effective in treating CMV.

Protein Design said initial test results show that patients who took Protovir and who did not have a CMV infection before receiving bone marrow transplants from CMV-positive donors, had lower rates of CMV infection, death or disease relapse than a control group. Tests covered a period of 98 days after transplants.

"The statistically significant results from this clinical trial provide preliminary evidence of the effectiveness of Protovir in preventing CMV infections in CMV naive bone marrow transplant patients," said Laurence Jay Korn, chief executive officer.
A total of 179 patients at three U.S. centers were enrolled in the random, double-blind study.

Patients received up to seven doses of either placebo, 15 mg, or 60 mg of Protovir. The first dose was administered one day befor transplant. Subsequent doses were given every other week. The study showed Protovir was well-tolerated and did not cause an immune response.
